FL.content: the just decision (rend time, defy dialectics) as madness, via Kierkegaard, madness because hyper-active and suffered, retains something passive
FL.linkedContent: the just decision (rend time, defy dialectics) as madness, via Kierkegaard, madness because hyper-active and suffered, retains something passive

LOBL.content: the passivity of “letting” is different from the passivity of couples and pairs (e.g. pair active/passive)
LOBL.linkedContent: the passivity of “letting” is different from the passivity of couples and pairs (e.g. pair active/passive)

POO.content: the analyst vs. the critic, participant in ritual vs. one who assumes an “objectifying” position (even if he is “close to passivity, if not passion” )
POO.linkedContent: the analyst vs. the critic, participant in ritual vs. one who assumes an “objectifying” position (even if he is “close to passivity, if not passion” )

OOG.content: w/ sedimented sense, first danger is passivity [for more of Husserl on passivity follow footnotes at bottom of page (p. 99n)]
OOG.linkedContent: w/ sedimented sense, first danger is passivity [for more of Husserl on passivity follow footnotes at bottom of page (p. 99n)]

A.content: nonpassive endurance of aporia: condition of responsibility, neither dialectizable contradiction like Hegel, Marx, nor transcendental illusion like Kant
A.linkedContent: nonpassive endurance of aporia: condition of responsibility, neither dialectizable contradiction like Hegel, Marx, nor transcendental illusion like Kant

PAS.content: eternal ring, passivity of nonpower, strength in reception, restarts alliance w/out debt, gift w/out credit
PAS.linkedContent: eternal ring, passivity of nonpower, strength in reception, restarts alliance w/out debt, gift w/out credit

PAS.content: immediately transgressive nature of pas in passivity enables passivity to surmount itself, to affirm
PAS.linkedContent: immediately transgressive nature of pas in passivity enables passivity to surmount itself, to affirm

PAS.content: Blanchot: to sleep in a passivity exactly like death, madness therefore
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: to sleep in a passivity exactly like death, madness therefore

PAS.content: Blanchot: “oh night…you become a delicious passivity”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: “oh night…you become a delicious passivity”

PAS.content: Blanchot: passivity is never passive enough, must talk about infinite passivity, beyond all formulations [passivité, passion, passé, pas]
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: passivity is never passive enough, must talk about infinite passivity, beyond all formulations [passivité, passion, passé, pas]

PAS.content: the other pas haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor
PAS.linkedContent: the other pas haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor

POOF.content: a passive decision, responsibility outside of knowledge, outside of subjective decisionism, occurs from the heartbeat of the other (blood arriving), which makes an exception for/of me > opens autonomy on to itself, matches decision to the gift, figure of the heartbeat: [passive decision doesn’t contradict sovereign decision, sovereign becomes guest, other?] [Derrida beyond Levinas]
POOF.linkedContent: a passive decision, responsibility outside of knowledge, outside of subjective decisionism, occurs from the heartbeat of the other (blood arriving), which makes an exception for/of me > opens autonomy on to itself, matches decision to the gift, figure of the heartbeat: [passive decision doesn’t contradict sovereign decision, sovereign becomes guest, other?] [Derrida beyond Levinas]

FWT.content: leave life in life & make it live again, “let live,” laisser, most beautiful, hazardous thing, like giving up, giving over the gift, forgiveness > deconstruction never w/out this love, pays homage to those it takes on, s’en prendre
FWT.linkedContent: leave life in life & make it live again, “let live,” laisser, most beautiful, hazardous thing, like giving up, giving over the gift, forgiveness > deconstruction never w/out this love, pays homage to those it takes on, s’en prendre

FWT.content: must be a leap from knowledge to decision, doesn’t take place w/out other, “passive” decision, decision of other, this doesn’t exonerate me [Derrida can prove this rationally, in the name of reason to come] > still necessary to know as much as possible before deciding
FWT.linkedContent: must be a leap from knowledge to decision, doesn’t take place w/out other, “passive” decision, decision of other, this doesn’t exonerate me [Derrida can prove this rationally, in the name of reason to come] > still necessary to know as much as possible before deciding

DS.content: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids
DS.linkedContent: simple opposition btwn activity & passivity becomes too formally weak to encompass graphics of hymen, its spider web, the play of its eyelids

SP.content: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)
SP.linkedContent: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)

ATIA.content: nudity as passivity, involuntary exhibition in face-to-face: the passion of the animal, my passion of the animal (other)
ATIA.linkedContent: nudity as passivity, involuntary exhibition in face-to-face: the passion of the animal, my passion of the animal (other)

ATIA.content: Bentham’s “can they suffer?” no longer question’s animality in relation to power, dynamis, hexis, habitus re: logos; suffering: “can they not be able?” > a power w/out power, possibility of the impossible, a passivity > mortality resides there, as radical means to contemplate our finitude alongside animals, the finitude of life: sharing this nonpower, vulnerability, anguish
ATIA.linkedContent: Bentham’s “can they suffer?” no longer question’s animality in relation to power, dynamis, hexis, habitus re: logos; suffering: “can they not be able?” > a power w/out power, possibility of the impossible, a passivity > mortality resides there, as radical means to contemplate our finitude alongside animals, the finitude of life: sharing this nonpower, vulnerability, anguish

ATIA.content: war of pity (denying animal’s suffering/avowing it), thinking begins when the animal looks at us and we are naked
ATIA.linkedContent: war of pity (denying animal’s suffering/avowing it), thinking begins when the animal looks at us and we are naked

GSP.content: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question
GSP.linkedContent: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question

PS.content: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive

SW.content: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts
SW.linkedContent: veil as “sa laisse (lead, leash, let)” > tears skin, touches, punctures, pulls, doesn’t just veil gaze; voilà, every word counts

SW.content: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night
SW.linkedContent: [BEAUTIFUL PASSAGE, as if they all aren’t] could a “theory of fetishism” ever measure up to infinite tenderness of “my own tallith” (as if such phrase preceded ipseity, “I”)? stranger to all maudlin, effusion, pathos—to all “Passion” > yet, compassion w/out limit: absolute delay of verdict that is/was/will make itself arrive w/out luminous vision (glory) > belongs to the night, my white tallith, absolute night

SW.content: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict
SW.linkedContent: tallith not incommensurable w/ fetish, but a generalized not restricted fetishism (Glas); theory of fetish no longer merely a theory at moment of verdict

PF.content: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen
PF.linkedContent: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen

PF.content: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”
PF.linkedContent: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”

PF.content: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity
PF.linkedContent: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity

PF.content: performativity exceeded by event (exposed to passivity)
not exonerated by decision of the other in me (passive decision): don’t give in to alibi of the other (ultimate creditor whose debt remains mine to discharge, God)
PF.linkedContent: not exonerated by decision of the other in me (passive decision): don’t give in to alibi of the other (ultimate creditor whose debt remains mine to discharge, God)

WAP.content: must struggle w/ (s’archaner) and submit to Kantian tradition, & critique/overvalue its “object,” reinstitute it by deconstructing its genealogy
WAP.linkedContent: must struggle w/ (s’archaner) and submit to Kantian tradition, & critique/overvalue its “object,” reinstitute it by deconstructing its genealogy

WAP.content: le présent discours [Derrida’s] ne saurait échapper totalement à la loi de cet espace [Kant’s], même s'il tente au moins de laisser filtrer une autre lueur (another glimmer), ou plus précisément de se laisser infiltrer (let itself be infiltrated) par une lueur qui déjà vient d'ailleurs et passe par tant de lézardes (so many cracks)
WAP.linkedContent: le présent discours [Derrida’s] ne saurait échapper totalement à la loi de cet espace [Kant’s], même s'il tente au moins de laisser filtrer une autre lueur (another glimmer), ou plus précisément de se laisser infiltrer (let itself be infiltrated) par une lueur qui déjà vient d'ailleurs et passe par tant de lézardes (so many cracks)

TN.content: touch as self-touching—le toucher plus tout autre sens (dizzy rhetoric), very form of space & time & will (essence of will) (from Descartes to Kant or even to Nietzsche)
TN.linkedContent: touch as self-touching—le toucher plus tout autre sens (dizzy rhetoric), very form of space & time & will (essence of will) (from Descartes to Kant or even to Nietzsche)

TN.content: to will is to will to touch, strange tautology, bends/folds oneself back into fold of passive-active auto-affection > this affect, that inflects/conjugates passive activity of will: desire
TN.linkedContent: to will is to will to touch, strange tautology, bends/folds oneself back into fold of passive-active auto-affection > this affect, that inflects/conjugates passive activity of will: desire

ATM.content: Levinas: in the just war waged against war, trembling, relaxed virility w/out cowardice—passivity more passive than any passivity
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: in the just war waged against war, trembling, relaxed virility w/out cowardice—passivity more passive than any passivity

ATM.content: for “passivity more passive than…” not to turn into its opposite: skin must be torn away and its adherence must be kept beneath the cut (a tearing away that limits itself)
ATM.linkedContent: for “passivity more passive than…” not to turn into its opposite: skin must be torn away and its adherence must be kept beneath the cut (a tearing away that limits itself)

ATM.content: “passivity more passive than…”: hear it as most provocative thought today, not a transgression, it was first of all provoked
ATM.linkedContent: “passivity more passive than…”: hear it as most provocative thought today, not a transgression, it was first of all provoked

EW.content: even in the most marked transcendental idealism (Husserl’s), alter-ego leads back to a pre-egological and pre-subjectivist zone (transcendental passive genesis of time and other)
EW.linkedContent: even in the most marked transcendental idealism (Husserl’s), alter-ego leads back to a pre-egological and pre-subjectivist zone (transcendental passive genesis of time and other)

AD.content: for Levinas, “substitution,” absolute passivity, “possibility of the impossible” that’s not Heidegger’s death, but the condition of the hostage, responsibility before/beyond death— impossibility of “slipping away (se dérober)”
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, “substitution,” absolute passivity, “possibility of the impossible” that’s not Heidegger’s death, but the condition of the hostage, responsibility before/beyond death— impossibility of “slipping away (se dérober)”

OG.content: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]
OG.linkedContent: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence > this passivity of speech is also a relation to the future, but not via anticipation [which would be a mastering of passivity]

OG.content: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general
OG.linkedContent: passivity of speech can’t be distinguished from relation btwn unconsciousness of language and spacing (pause, blank, punctuation, interval) that constitutes origin of signification in general

OG.content: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology
OG.linkedContent: becoming-space of time & becoming-time of space mark dead time w/in presence of living present > dead time is at work, les blancs take on importance > limit of phenomenology

OG.content: via Rousseau, speech excites attention, the visible exacts it (la parole excite l’attention, le visible l’exige)—is that because the ear, always open, is more passive than sight?
OG.linkedContent: via Rousseau, speech excites attention, the visible exacts it (la parole excite l’attention, le visible l’exige)—is that because the ear, always open, is more passive than sight?

OG.content: the violent penetration of speech, passivity, reception obliged, interiorization, “s’entendre-parler”—passion: Rousseau suspects speech’s violence, the complicity of voice & heart
OG.linkedContent: the violent penetration of speech, passivity, reception obliged, interiorization, “s’entendre-parler”—passion: Rousseau suspects speech’s violence, the complicity of voice & heart

OG.content: from Kant to Husserl: Kantian revolution of pure passivity re: pure sensibility—still a linear, geometric, transcendental aesthetic; Husserl’s transcendental kinesthetic blurs lines btwn passive/active, puts all objective space in parentheses > but still living present
OG.linkedContent: from Kant to Husserl: Kantian revolution of pure passivity re: pure sensibility—still a linear, geometric, transcendental aesthetic; Husserl’s transcendental kinesthetic blurs lines btwn passive/active, puts all objective space in parentheses > but still living present

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation

P(P).content: if the question corresponds to a demand from the other, elle se laisse déjà précéder par une étrange affirmation > pour veiller sur elle [to guard this affirmation], peut-être faut-il d’abord se rendre à la veille de la question
P(P).linkedContent: if the question corresponds to a demand from the other, elle se laisse déjà précéder par une étrange affirmation > pour veiller sur elle [to guard this affirmation], peut-être faut-il d’abord se rendre à la veille de la question
